title: travelplanner: We're planning a week-long trip for two from Pittsburgh to New York with a budget of $5,300. We're set to travel from March 13th to March 19th, 2022, and plan to visit three different cities in New York. Please keep in mind that our lodgings must allow visitors. As for meals, we'd love to sample French, Italian, Chinese, and American cuisines. Also, note that we're planning to travel without taking any flights. (90af3d4ca5768d41)

always_included_messages.content: Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.

chat_history.content: We're planning a week-long trip for two from Pittsburgh to New York with a budget of $5,300. We're set to travel from March 13th to March 19th, 2022, and plan to visit three different cities in New York. Please keep in mind that our lodgings must allow visitors. As for meals, we'd love to sample French, Italian, Chinese, and American cuisines. Also, note that we're planning to travel without taking any flights.

# New York Trip Itinerary from Pittsburgh

## Summary

For your week-long trip to New York, I've chosen three cities you can visit while sticking to your budget of $5,300 and avoiding flights: Buffalo, Islip, and Manhattan. As you're travelling in mid-March, we've focused on cities that won't be too chilly at this time of year.

## Itinerary

- **Day 1: Travel to Buffalo** - Take a bus to Buffalo. You'd need to leave quite early to make the most of the day. Once you arrive, check into your accommodation and take some time to rest. In the afternoon, visit the Buffalo Zoo, home to over 1,200 animals. In the evening, head to the Anchor Bar for dinner, a historic restaurant famous for its Buffalo wings.
- **Day 2: Explore Buffalo** - Take a trip to Niagara Falls, one of the most popular attractions in the country. You can also take a boat tour, which is a great way to see the falls up close. Spend the evening at BillyClub, a popular restaurant with a varied menu, including American, French and Italian options.
- **Day 3: Travel to Islip** - Take a bus to Islip. In the afternoon, visit the Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, which showcases American art and historical objects. For dinner, visit the Library Café, known for its American-style food.
- **Day 4: Explore Islip** - Begin your day at the Bayard Cutting Arboretum State Park. This park features a historic mansion and various walking trails. Afterwards, visit the Oheka Castle, a historic hotel with a renowned restaurant. You can opt for a delicious lunch here with a French-inspired menu.
- **Day 5: Travel to Manhattan** - Take a bus to Manhattan, arriving in the morning. Start your day at the Statue of Liberty, a famous landmark offering beautiful views. Then, enjoy a river cruise along the Hudson River, where you'll catch great views of the city. For dinner, try the famous Chinese restaurant Joe's Shanghai.
- **Day 6: Explore Manhattan** - Visit the 9/11 Memorial and Museum, a moving and educational experience. Afterwards, stroll through Central Park, an iconic park with various attractions. In the evening, head to Carbone, a highly-rated Italian restaurant.
- **Day 7: Last Day in Manhattan** - In the morning, take a walk across the iconic Brooklyn Bridge. Then, visit the Metropolitan Museum of Art, one of the world's largest and most renowned art museums. For your final dinner in New York, try the Gramercy Tavern, famous for its American cuisine.

## Transportation

There are several bus companies that offer services from Pittsburgh to New York, with prices typically ranging from $30 to $70 for a one-way ticket. These buses usually include amenities like Wi-Fi and power outlets. Once you're in New York, you can use public transport or ride-sharing services for intra-state travel.

## Accommodation

For your stay, I've found highly-rated hotels with good visitor reviews and within your budget. You can expect to pay around $150 to $250 per night for a double room.

## Food Budget

With your budget, you can easily afford to dine in a variety of restaurants in New York. A meal for two at a mid-range restaurant costs around $60, while a meal at a high-end restaurant can range from $100 to $200 for two people.

Here's a rough budget breakdown for your meals:
- Buffalo: $200
- Islip: $300
- Manhattan: $700

## Saved Itinerary

| Day | Plan |
|---|---|
| 1 | Travel to Buffalo, visit Buffalo Zoo, dinner at Anchor Bar |
| 2 | Trip to Niagara Falls, dinner at BillyClub |
| 3 | Travel to Islip, visit Long Island Museum of American Art, History and Carriages, dinner at Library Café |
| 4 | Visit Bayard Cutting Arboretum State Park, lunch at Oheka Castle |
| 5 | Travel to Manhattan, visit Statue of Liberty, Hudson River cruise, dinner at Joe's Shanghai |
| 6 | Visit 9/11 Memorial and Museum, stroll through Central Park, dinner at Carbone |
| 7 | Walk across Brooklyn Bridge, visit Metropolitan Museum of Art, dinner at Gramercy Tavern |

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
